resources.string:
La Termal Desde Adentro is an application for devices with Android system. 
It provides information about everything that tourists should know when visiting the city of Pcia. Roque Sáenz Peña Chaco Argentina. 
Application created by 
Roy Alexis Genoff. 
Version 1.6. 
Icons of findicons.com 
Map Icons of mapicons.nicolasmollet.com
Without an internet connection, verify your connection and try again
There is no information on the weather at this time, try later

Currency: Argentine Pesos 

Language: Spanish Time Zone: GMT-3 

Weights and Measures: International System of Units 

Climate: The average annual temperature is 21.5ºC and the average annual relative humidity is 74%. They usually register in winter minimum temperatures of below -5 ° C, and maximum in summer that exceed 44 ° C 

The bus terminal is located at 
See Map 

For tourist reports call the following numbers: 
Phone 1 
Phone 2 

For more information about the city visit: 
MunicipalitySP

City Airport.
See Map


Historical Building of the Telegraph Radio.
See Map

Stadium Arena Uncaus.
See Map

Mural of the City.
See Map

Train Station.
See Map

\"Presidencia Roque Sáenz Peña or simply Saenz Peña is the second most populated city in the province of Chaco, Argentina, is the head of the department Comandante Fernández, in the province it is usually called La Termal, because of the thermal waters that constitute one of its main tourist attractions In the year 2010 had 89 882 inhabitants.The geographical coordinates are 26º 47 \'27 S, 60º 26 29\' W, at an altitude of 90.00 meters above sea level and 168 kilometers from the provincial capital , Resistencia.\"

\"Sáenz Peña is crossed by national routes 16 and 95, both paved, becoming a center for its proximity to most of the Chaco populations, Route 16 being the most important, communicating it to the southeast with Quitilipi and Resistencia. The northwest links it with Aviá Teraí and the Province of Salta, Route 95 links it to the north with Tres Isletas and the Province of Formosa, and to the south with Villa Ángela and the Province of Santa Fe.\"
